meanings.definition: The state or quality of being defective.
meanings.sent1: The defectivenesses of the toy were evident in its broken parts.
meanings.sent2: The inspector noted the defectivenesses in the product's design.
meanings.sent3: The defectivenesses of the cake made it look like a lopsided tower.
meanings.sent4: Her argument was full of holes, revealing the defectivenesses in her logic.
meanings.sent5: The defectivenesses of the plan became apparent when it failed to work.

meanings.definition: The presence of defects or flaws.
meanings.sent1: The defectivenesses in the painting were visible under the bright light.
meanings.sent2: The manufacturer had to recall the product due to defectivenesses in its structure.
meanings.sent3: Despite the defectivenesses, the old car still ran smoothly.
meanings.sent4: The defectivenesses in the system caused frequent malfunctions.
meanings.sent5: The defectivenesses of the diamond were only noticeable under a magnifying glass.

meanings.definition: The lack of perfection or completeness.
meanings.sent1: The defectivenesses of the plan became apparent when key details were missing.
meanings.sent2: The artist embraced the defectivenesses in the sculpture, considering them part of its charm.
meanings.sent3: The defectivenesses of the puzzle made it challenging to complete.
meanings.sent4: The defectivenesses in her speech were evident in the stammering pauses.
meanings.sent5: The defectivenesses of the map led them astray during the hike.
